direction.raw_text: back into the holster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think they'd dare call the cops. (giggles) But it'll cost me a few bucks if they do. He claps Easy on the back as if it's all been in fun and giggles like a kid on his way toward the hamburger stand. Easy looks at him numbly and tags alongside, clutching his anger in tightly clenched jaws.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got, Easy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure no harm is gonna come to that woman 'cause of me? Albright doesn't break stride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course not. Mr. Carter wants to buy her a gold ring and live happily ever after -- What do ya got? Easy exhales, feeling trapped, but he's come this far...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woman told me she's with a man named Frank Green. Albright stops; the charm gone, he's all business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 36   CONTINUED:                                                    36 EASY He's got an apartment at the Skyler Arms on Skyler and Eighty-third. Albright scribbles it down on a note pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank's a gangster. A hijacker... Liquor and cigarettes. He's real good with a knife. Albright is unable to suppress a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever seen him in action?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.   I just heard about him. Albright, still grinning, pulls out the brown "secretary" and counts out more bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's another hundred. He shoves the money into Easy's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy ya a burger, Easy? He starts into the screen door of the hamburger stand but Easy declines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks, Mr. Albright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you let those boys get around you like that? War hero should have been able to pick 'em off one by one before they got you against the rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't kill children. For some reason this is hilarious to Albright. He throws his head back and wheezes out an almost silent belly laugh, then winds down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 36   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy. He disappears into the hamburger joint and Easy walks away back toward his car. 37   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                        37 Easy pulls in front of his house and notices a dark Ford parked across the street as he gets out of his car. A tall, skinny white MAN in a dark blue suit gets out just ahead of his slightly shorter and heavyset FRIEND. Easy watches them as he moves toward his walkway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They approach fast but cautiously, the fat one with a hand in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins, I'm Miller and this is my partner, Mason. They both hold out badges. Mason is a slob with grease spots on his wrinkled tan suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We want you to come with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see. And he takes Easy by the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You arresting me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see. And he starts pulling Easy toward the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a right to know why you're taking--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 37   CONTINUED:                                                      37 WHOMP! Easy takes one to the diaphragm, and as he doubles over the fat detective slips the handcuffs on behind his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a right to fall down and break your face, nigger. You got a right to die. The two cops drag Easy to the car and dump him into the back seat where he lies gagging as the car whisks away. 38   INT. POLICE STATION                                             38 Easy's head sags down as he's dragged through the front door past blurred blue bodies that talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got 'im, huh, Miller?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we got him coming home. Nothing on 'im. A door opens and Easy finds himself being flung inside. 39   INT. INTERROGATION ROOM                                         39 On his knees he hears the door close and looks up at a single, bare wooden chair resting on the corroded linoleum floor. He crawls to one of the urine-stained corners, and looks down on a dry, flat corpse of a mouse. He pushes his shoulder against the unpainted plaster until he's standing and then stumbles over to the chair and sits. He looks up at the bare pipes that run along the ceiling, dripping water, and at a window with criss-cross chairs instead of glass framing, overgrown branches and leaves pushing their way in. THE DOOR opens and Miller comes in first carrying a notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ezekiel Rawlins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Mason follows and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can take off the cuffs if you wanna cooperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 39   CONTINUED:                                                     39 EASY I'm cooperating. Miller motions to Mason and he removes the cuffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you this morning at about five A.M.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He means-- He plants his foot in Easy's chest and pushes him over backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --this morning. Easy has caught himself and stands back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I was out drinkin' and I helped carry a friend home. I could've been on my way home... I don't know... I didn't look at a clock...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't look at a clock. WHOCK! Easy takes a fist to the ear and struggles to keep his balance, wiping away blood streaming down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were drinkin' down on Eighty- ninth and Central... At an illegal club called John's, weren't you? Mason moves again but this time Easy turns to face him and the fat man looks back with an innocent face, his palms turned up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may as well answer 'cause you got bigger troubles than us bustin' an illegal bar, Ezekiel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?    What's goin' on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 39   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Means we can take your black ass out behind the station and put a bullet in your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now. What time did you leave Coretta James' house this morning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess about five... five- thirty... Miller and Mason glance at each other, and Mason kicks the chair over toward Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, I'm gonna sit down and you keep trying to knock me down? But he sits down anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you go back and see Miss James later in the day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you and Dupree Brouchard have words over Miss James?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard 'im. Did you two argue over Coretta James?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.   He was asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She went to sleep too, Ezekiel. But she won't be waking up... Easy's face goes sick...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 39   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you go when you left Miss James' house? Easy is too stunned to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard him, where'd you go? Easy stares into space, answering in barely a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went home with a hangover... CHOONK! CHOONK! Mason fires off two punches and Easy grabs his wrists and pulls him down to the floor, swinging around, straddling Mason sitting on his ass... Miller's police special presses into Easy's temple and Miller speaks to him quietly, deadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up slow... Real fuckin' slow or you know what's gonna happen. Easy raises his hands and uncoils to his feet, backing away cautiously. Mason is winded and furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   Let's take him out back. He gets to his feet and reaches for his gun, but Miller stops his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit, I'm gonna blow his--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go! He pushes Mason toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son-of-a-bitch! Son-of-a-bitch! They exit the door and Easy rubs at his bloody ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   EXT. L.A. CITY JAIL - NIGHT                                     40 Easy walks down the steps of the station buttoning up his top shirt button, his hand cupped to his aching ear to keep out the chill of the night air. The street is dark and deserted like a giant black alley except for the black and white patrol car that sits at the curb. A taut-faced officer leans out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Buddy!... It's a long walk... why don't you let us give you a ride? Easy walks across the street off into the darkness... 41   EXT. FOURTH STREET BRIDGE - NIGHT                               41 A snatch of MUSIC and LAUGHTER startles Easy as he trudges home and a car full of teenagers shoots by. And then... A BLACK CADILLAC LIMOUSINE cruises up behind and drives alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you!   Ezekiel Rawlins! The window rolls down all the way and a white face in a black cap appears in the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ezekiel, hold on. Easy keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, fella. Somebody in the back wants to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have time right now. He doubles his pace, almost running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jump in. We'll take you.    My boss wants to talk to you. Easy cuts behind the limo and into the street headed for the other side of the bridge but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   CONTINUED:                                                      41 The Cadillac whips a U-turn blocking his way in the middle of the street while cars pass, honking, on either side. The tall angular chauffeur gets out of the car and holds up his hands as if making peace. Easy starts to make another move to escape but:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. If we wanted to hurt you it would have already happened... He opens the back door and after a few moments, Easy gets in. 42   INT. LIMOUSINE - NIGHT                                          42 Easy settles into the seat with his back to the driver. Edith Piaf's "Parles Moi D'Amour" adds sugar to the strong smell of cologne and the portly form of Matthew Teran sits across from him with a small MEXICAN BOY in pajamas seated next to him holding a small elephant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see that the police roughed you up a bit... That's a terrible practice of theirs which has to change, Mr. Rawlins... Has to change. He opens his gold cigarette case and offers Easy a cigarette. Easy accepts and Teran lights them both up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was beaten. And died from a heavy blow to the back of the head, Mr. Rawlins. Easy begins to feel nauseous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The evening's events have caught my adopted son and I quite off guard... My household was asleep when we got the call that the police had a suspect in Coretta James' murder... Did you know that she was a friend of mine, Mr. Rawlins!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I didn't, Mr. Teran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 42   CONTINUED:                                                    42 TERAN Oh, you know who I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I read the papers.   You're runnin' for mayor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the next mayor, Mr. Rawlins... And luckily for you, a friend of the Negro... When I arrived at the station I knew right off that you were being improperly detained as is Coretta's boyfriend, Dupree Brouchard. It's this sort of thing that my administration will not tolerate, Mr. Rawlins. Absolutely will not... He sits back in his seat self righteously and offers a nod of assurance and awaits Easy's gratitude... Then after a moment...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes... Coretta answered phones for a while in my campaign office on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rd and Western. In fact my people got her a job in the phone company. So when I heard what had happened I got out of bed immediately, personally because of my concern... Was anyone there with you Mr. Rawlins besides Mr. Dupree Brouchard?... Any... other friends of Coretta's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No young lady perhaps?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not, Mr. Rawlins. And why should you tell a man whom you've only just met. But, believe me, Mr. Rawlins. You can trust me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 42   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was no one else. Teran's face sags with disappointment and then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well don't worry, Mr. Rawlins... I won't tolerate your being harassed... You or any of my constituency -- I was a city councilman in the Watts area for two terms with a large contingent of colored -- I value all of my supporters equally... humble though they may be -- where can we drop you, Mr. Rawlins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can let me out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure, Mr. Rawlins? This must be quite out of your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. The little boy stares up at Easy through big, dark almond- shaped eyes in the silence that follows. And then, Teran picks up the ivory horn that hangs next to his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman, pull the car over. 43   EXT. WAREHOUSE AREA - NIGHT                                      43 The limousine stops and Easy pushes the door open and gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins, may I offer you cab fare? Teran's stubby fingers hold out crumpled bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks. Easy closes the door and watches the long Cadillac glide away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 43   CONTINUED:                                                      43 EASY (V.O.) There had been nights during the war that I still had trouble claiming as part of my life... Insane nights I wasn't sure ever really happened. And here I was again... Had I really just gotten out of a rich man's car who was runnin' for mayor?.. Running against the man I was supposed to be working for... Was he really lookin' for the same woman I was trying to find? My ear was killin' me and the buses had stopped running. And I was feeling sick... Sick from wondering if I had really hard that Coretta was dead. 44   INT. EASY'S HOUSE - BEDROOM                                     44 The room is a mess; trousers strewn here, shirt and shoes over there. And from the corners are haunting, ghostly whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You be sorry if you go... (heavy breathing) I can't give up that much love, daddy, not the way things is. A PINT OF BOURBON, 3/4 full, sits atop the cherry wood nightstand. Another empty bottle lies next to it on its side, in front of a water glass with 1/2 inch of liquor at the bottom. EASY'S HEAD rests on a pillow on the bed behind it, sweating, tossing and turning as the ghost gets louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, daddy. You hittin' my spot... Oh yeah... oh yeah... The voice of the ghost is reaching closer for his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that's just too good, Easy.   Oh daddy... oh yeah... The voice is right up in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, baby. Oh, daddy, yeah... Oh yeah!! Oh Yea-a-h!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 44   CONTINUED:                                                     44 SCREAM. He jerks up, awake, and the phone is RINGING.    It jingles a couple more times and Easy almost knocks the receiver out of its cradle reaching for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Is this Mr. Rawlins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daphne... Daphne Monet... He sits straight up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're looking for me. A pause on the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you should come and talk to me, Mr. Rawlins... alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, it's late--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins, Coretta has been killed... Another pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you don't want any trouble from the police then you'll come... And you won't tell anyone that you're coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now wait a minute, Daphne. I don't know nothin' about all this stuff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm at the Sunridge Motel on 112th and Grand, Room 102.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 44   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. The door opens and she's standing there, more beautiful than the photograph. They take each other in for a moment before she steps back from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please come in. 48   INT. MOTEL ROOM                                                  48 It's a regular drab, cheap motel that she has given a warmer touch with colorful scarves draped over the two lamps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like a drink? She indicates a pint of scotch on the dresser with an empty glass and one that she's been drinking from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks. She indicates the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please sit down. She's wearing a blue dress that's plain, cutting just below her knee with a ceramic pin just over her left breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 48   CONTINUED:                                                     48 DAPHNE What happened to you?   Have you been fighting? Easy stubs out his cigarette in an ashtray and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you just tell me what you want? She sits down too, her calm but brittle exterior betrayed at the hands. She stops wringing them when she sees that he notices and takes a drink -- more medicine than pleasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be asking you that question. Why have you been asking about me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard about you. Fellas at John's said you were something to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...?   You've found me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... yeah... Guess I have. But you got a boyfriend I don't want no part of... Frank Green. She lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can stop pretending, Mr. Rawlins. I know someone hired you to look for me. In fact I had to pay Coretta not to tell you where I was... you know how Coretta is... (forces a weak smile) She told me you two became 'good friends' yesterday... (tears gather in her eyes) I talked to her this morning before she died. (regaining control) I... uh... need to go across town to see someone. It's very important... I can't seem to reach him by phone. I'm afraid I'd better have someone go with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 48   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... Miss Monet--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Daphne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daphne--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can understand why you'd be nervous... because I threatened you with Coretta... I'm very sorry, but I couldn't think of any other way to get you to come. She takes another drink and stubs out her cigarette though it's less than a third gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't -- why don't you ask Frank? She gets up and starts to pace nervously about the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's out of town -- I... I'm willing to pay you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice of you but, see, I'm not really a detective--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just hired to ask around to try to find you for a man--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all about that, Mr. Rawlins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But this is a gettin' a little out of hand--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Mr. Rawlins--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 48   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy... If you don't help me, then I'll call the police and tell them that you were with Coretta before she died and that you've been after me too. That stops Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I would.    I don't want to but I would. She hates herself for threatening and decides to change direction, moving in close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please let me pay you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.    I can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want no part of all this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, I'll pay you twenty dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No dice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty... or even more.    Name your price. She moves in closer, massaging with her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. There's gotta be something that you want. Her eyes make an offer, but he's a better man than me and he's not taking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 48   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Are you afraid I'll yell rape or something? She walks away and turns up her glass, her desperation, raw, unguarded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Miss Monet... Daphne, I'm sorry but I really better be goin'. He starts out and she runs to stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, don't touch that door-- He opens it and SCREAM!   Like an alarm, she's SHRIEKING all of the scale. 49   He looks out and sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazy assed broad!   What the hell are you doing?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm really very sorry.   I really am. She pulls on a coat and grabs her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to do this but... Shall we? She grabs an already packed suitcase and is out the door. 51   EXT. LAUREL CANYON - NIGHT                                     51 Easy's Pontiac snakes up the winding road, city lights glimmering in flashes below as it rounds the curves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 52   INT. EASY'S CAR - NIGHT                                         52 Ben Webster's "I've   Got It Bad" plays on the road as Easy shifts nervously in   his seat, his eyes searching in the rearview mirror and   all around for headlights that might be unfriendly. Daphne    leans back against the passenger door, taking him in. Easy passes a police car pulled over to the side. He looks in the rearview mirror and its headlights go on. He takes a deep breath, bracing for the worst and Daphne looks back concerned. But the lights arch a U-turn and head back the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must not have seen us that well... God, Frank and I have been pulled over so many times I thought-- She catches herself and looks over at Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, I'm sorry... Don't be mad at me. Easy keeps his eyes on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. She tries to touch his arm and he pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really hate me, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much further is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around the next bend... (she grins) You remind me of Frank when he gets angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't nothin' about me like Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your jaw sets just like his when--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 52   CONTINUED:                                                      52 EASY I don't get no kick outta risking my life for some white woman's entertainment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just park behind the Studebaker. 53   EXT. RICHARD'S CABIN / INT. EASY'S PONTIAC                      53 The Studebaker is parked at a deadend in the street.    Easy pulls in behind. The cabin is so overgrown with ivy that all this is visible is the mailbox and address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you bring a gun or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, that's not very smart. Everybody carries a weapon now a days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then where's yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Search me sometime.   You'll find it. She gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn... He frowns and gets out of the car. 54   OMIT                                                            54 55   EXT. RICHARD'S CABIN - NIGHT                                    55 Daphne waits, clutching her suitcase and lets Easy lead the way. They get to the door and find it ajar.    Easy takes a look inside and then cautiously steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 56   INT. RICHARD'S CABIN - NIGHT                                        56 He flicks on the wall switch. It's a typical little hideaway that the rich kept for summer use. The living room, dining room, and kitchen are all in one with a long counter separating the kitchen. On the left is a wooden couch with a Mexican rug thrown across it and a metal chair with tan cushions for the seat and back. The opposite wall is all glass with the city lights blinking in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. McGee... No answer.   Easy leads them to a door and opens it. 57   BEDROOM                                                             57 Another wall of glass and A DEAD MAN spread out on the king-sized bed, with the contents of the dresser and closet strewn all over the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God! She gags and backs out of the room with her hand over her mouth in case she throws up. Easy takes out a handkerchief and holds it over his mouth and nose as he gets a closer look at the body. It's the drunk white man he had seen at John's Speakeasy in the same blue suit. He's lying on his back like a crucifix with a butcher knife buried in his chest. There's blood that has drained from his chest and gathered around his face and hair so dark and thick you could scoop it up like Jello. Easy actually does throw up and doubles over, dropping to a knee to keep his balance and some control. He stays there for several moments regaining his composure and then spots a spilled ashtray and a cigarette butt. He lifts it off the floor and smells it. He wipes his mouth with the handkerchief and then wraps the butt inside and puts it in his pocket. He gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daphne! He hears a CAR ENGINE start up and GEARS SHIFTING.     Then runs out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   EXT. RICHARD'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                       58 A pink Studebaker whips backward out the driveway. Easy runs alongside trying to stop Daphne as she screeches into the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, wait a minute! She speeds off down the canyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit! He stands in the middle of the street, watching her go. 59   INT. EASY'S CAR - SUNRISE                                          59 Fiery orange light bounces off the hood of the car into Easy's face as he turns the corner onto his block. He is surprised to see A WHITE CADILLAC parked in front of his house.      And now it's his front door that's open. BACK TO EASY He pulls in behind the Caddy and gets out. 60   INT. EASY'S HOUSE                                                  60 He pushes open the door. Shariff loiters just inside, grinning at him, and Manny stands in the middle of the living room looking at the floor. From a RADIO in another room Tommy Dorsey plays "Blue Skies" with Frank Sinatra out front. And so Easy walks past the two hoods into THE KITCHEN Albright turns from looking out the backyard window with a porcelain coffee cup cradled in his right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy. Easy looks at the coffee pot on the stove and again at Albright, smiling loose and friendly but looking tired in the same clothes he had on at the pier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you doin' in my house, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expected you to be home, so Manny used a screwdriver on the door. What happened to your face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED:                                                      60 EASY You got no excuse to be breakin' into my house -- What if I broke into your place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd tear your nigger head out by its root. Easy boils inside and then goes over to the counter to pour himself a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been this time of morning, Easy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went to see a girl. Don't you get none, Mr. Albright? The smile leaves Albright's face and his eyes turn even colder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't come here to play, boy. You got my money in your pocket and we've been over at that address waitin' all night for Frank Green and now we've found out that he moved from there over a year ago. Easy is scared and confused but he plays it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do you want me to do about it? You don't think I did my job. Shit, I give you the money back. And he reaches for his pocket, but Albright reaches too -- and suddenly, Manny and Shariff are in the room and on Easy like a vice. Albright presses the barrel of the .45 against Easy's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe in God, Easy? 'Cause I'm curious to see if death is any different for a religious man. Easy looks down, away from the gun, and swallows hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen her. After a moment, everyone relaxes and Easy sags out from under their grip and staggers into 61   THE LIVING ROOM                                                 61 Manny and Shariff surround him as he sits down in a chair and Albright stalks in holstering his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She called me. Had me drive up to the Hollywood Hills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd she know about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess Coretta... the girl that told me about Daphne and Frank Green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you call me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't. She threatened to tell the cops that I had killed Coretta... Albright looks over at his henchmen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She took off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! While I was looking at the body she split.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-hunh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 61   CONTINUED:                                                       61 Albright looks around the room as if answers lie in the corners, but he is not surprised to hear about a body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You call the cops?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried my best to keep in the speed limit. That's all I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd she do, take his car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hunh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McGee.   Did she take his car? Easy hesitates, "How did Albright know his name?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you pick her up at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She left that place--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Write it down! To his shame Easy flinches and gets paper from his end table, then scribbles down the address and hands it to Albright who takes Easy's seat and examines the note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me some whiskey, Easy. Easy studies Albright who sits knees wide apart, now the master of the house, and he can't help himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get it yourself... Bottle's in the cabinet. Albright looks up and Easy braces himself for Albright to bring on the end, all at once. But slowly a smile spreads across Albright's face and he laughs, stamping his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 61   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be damned. Get us a drink, Manny... Easy, you're a brave man. I need a brave man working for me... But you gotta find Frank Green, so he can lead us to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks, Mr. Albright. People are gettin' killed all around me... You never said anything about all this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, you're connectable to two murders. You'll do whatever I tell you to do. Manny brings Albright's drink and the captain turns it up and gives Manny back the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you got three days to find him. And you make sure you count 'em right. He walks out the screen door with Manny and Shariff following. 62   KITCHEN                                                        62 Easy grabs the bottle from the counter, where Manny has left it, and pours himself a stiff one. But he only stares into the glass. FLASHBACK: 63   EXT. BATTLEFIELD - DAY                                         63 Dense black smoke masks everything but two vague figures in a struggle. The BOOM of heavy artillery gives way only to the deafening CHATTER of automatic fire. We are hurtling forward into a horror-stricken Easy in combat gear, repeatedly stabbing an already lifeless German soldier. Tears are streaming down Easy's face, his mouth gaped open in an inaudible SCREAM. 64   BACK TO SCENE                                                  64 He studies the glass and pushes it away.   Then looks
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 65    OUT THE WINDOW                                                  65 Albright and his two goons get in the white Caddy and cruise away. 66    BEDROOM                                                         66 He dials the operator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I needed help... Albright didn't flinch at hearing that Coretta was dead and he seemed to know all about Richard McGee too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raymond Alexander on... He pauses, speechless as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about it, operator. He hangs up, his eyes trained in thought. A67   EXT. JOPPY'S BAR - DAY                                         A67 A crowd has gathered along the street to watch a three convertible car caravan: the first car bearing a four-place band playing "Happy Days Are Here Again"; the second with someone who could be Lana Turner holding up a "Teran for Mayor" placard with a man in the front passenger seat announcing through a megaphone; and last, but hardly least, Matthew Teran blowing kisses and waving two small American flags. Easy looks up for a moment as he closes the trunk of his car to watch the parade. Then stuffs a ball peen hammer in the waistband at the small of his back, under his jacket. He walks with a purpose into the open door next to the butcher shop. B67   INT. JOPPY'S BAR                                               B67 Easy stops in the doorway, seeing JOPPY as usual buffing the marble top of his bar. T-Bone Walker's "They Call It Stormy Monday" is on the jukebox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . B67   CONTINUED:                                                    B67 BACK TO EASY He scans the bar and sees that there are no customers, and walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Easy. Easy stops at the bar and stares at Joppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That girl called me last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What girl is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one your friend is lookin' for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, huh.   That's pretty lucky, hunh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Joppy... Wasn't no luck at all. It was you. Joppy inadvertently clenches his fists and notices Easy's aggressive stance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Coretta was the only ones that had my phone number who knew I was lookin' for her. And Coretta was busy scammin' Daphne so she wouldn't have done it... It was you, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she looked in the phone book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't in the phone book, Joppy... Joppy's eyes narrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell you mean, coming up here all mad like you gonna do something?!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . B67   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You damn right! Coretta's dead! Your friend Albright is on my ass. The cops done brought me down once
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you just tell Albright your damn self?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I tell you? To just take that man's money! I didn't tell you to do nothin'! I call myself trying to help you save your house... Don't come up in here startin' no shit with me. And he pulls a baseball bat from behind the bar, but Easy has pulled his hammer and SMACKS it down hard, cracking the beveled wood that frames the marble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, wait! Watch my marble! My uncle left me that when he died!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And goddammit, he's about to get it back. He draws back for the downswing, and Joppy drops the baseball bat, holding up his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's talk.   Let's just talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you got me into, Joppy?! Joppy inhales, forcing himself to be calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She asked me to help her 'cause I told her that Albright was lookin' for her. And I figured I could help you make a few bucks and throw Albright off the trail too. She wanted to know something about you so I told her... I guess I must've give her your phone number...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . B67   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't lie to me, Joppy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't lyin'... I don't even know her that good. She just asked me to help her. And she asked me not to tell nobody... I guess 'cause of her and Frank Green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's she runnin' from Joppy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear I don't know. She didn't tell me. I didn't mean to get you into nothin', Easy... I just... she just... I mean you seen her, Easy... Man, she's something else. Easy can see "sucker" written all over Joppy as he fumbles for a cigarette with one hand and shakes his head with disgust as he lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, Joppy. Is there any white woman that ever gave you the time of day that you wasn't a sucker for? Joppy frowns painfully and continues to wipe the bar. 67    EXT. T. CARTER FOUNDATION - DAY                                 67 Easy turns into the winding driveway through the stone entrance way that bears the name of this distinguished institution on a bronze plate. He parks the car and gets   out, adjusting his dark brown Stetson which matches his   pin-stripped suit. He looks around at the massive and   well manicured grounds and walks into a patio area of this   Spanish-style complex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albright had said that when you're mixed up in something it's best to be mixed up to the top. I could see his point. So that's where I was going... all the way to the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 68   EXT. CARTER FOUNDATION PATIO                                   68 An ELDERLY SECRETARY descends an outdoor curved stairway carrying a file. She spots Easy looking around confused and immediately becomes annoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... yes.   I came to see Mr. Carter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have an appointment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm sorry, but Mr. Carter is a very busy man. Easy pulls out Albright's business card and hands it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, tell him Mr. Albright sent me, and it's real important. She looks at the card and then up at Easy with annoyed superiority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I ask the nature of your call, Mister...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rawlins. But I'm not so sure he'd want me to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm quite sure, Mr. Rawlins, that whatever you know is nothing I can't know as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Well, anyway, tell him I'm here with information about that little chippy of his that dumped him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this some sort of joke? O.S. VOICE Uh... Excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 68   CONTINUED:                                                     68 Easy and the secretary turn to see a TALL MAN in a dark grey suit with bushy black hair and thick eyebrows standing in the doorway. He forces a smile and comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins was it? He holds out his hand and Easy shakes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   Mister...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baxter. (to the secretary) I'll take care of this. (and back to Easy) Why don't you come with me, sir? They walk through the door into 69   A HALLWAY                                                      69 BAXTER Not very smart talking about Mr. Carter's business to a secretary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna hear it, man. It's too much goin' on for me to give a damn about what you think is smart. Baxter bristles up and slows down his walk, about to put Easy in his place. But Easy slows down too and squares up on him. Baxter reconsiders and leads the way up a stone staircase. 70   INT. CARTER'S OFFICE                                           70 Baxter ushers Easy into a huge elegantly furnished room more closely resembling a hall than an office with large arched doors and windows leading out onto a stone veranda overlooking a canyon. Alone looking out at the greenery on the opposite hillside is TODD CARTER. Baxter walks out and speaks with Carter, while Easy watches them from inside the office. The rich man perks up with interest and hurries inside with Baxter who throws Easy a dirty look on his way out. He pauses uncertainly wearing a simple Sears Roebuck-looking tan suit with a plain open- collared white shirt. The dark circles under his eyes show nights without sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:                                                    70 CARTER Mr. Rawlins. He runs a hand through his thinning red hair, and offers an overstuffed sofa. They sit on either end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has something happened to Daphne?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last time I saw her she looked fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saw her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   Last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's still in town?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did she say -- what was she wearing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blue dress.    Blue heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a pin on her chest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, on the left side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes, that's her. That's her. You know I've never known a woman who could wear perfume so slight that--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Mr. Carter, Mr. Carter--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did she say? What did she say?... Oh, I'm sorry. Brandy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Carter. I came here to get some answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I'm takin' a helluva chance... Carter runs his hand through his hair again, the suspense killing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess it's just that when I'm working for somebody, I wanna know what I'm gettin' myself into... Carter leans in as if he missed something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'd like to know the real reason why Mr. Albright hired me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Albright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. The man you hired to find Daphne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There must be some mistake... I'm sorry, busy... Who are you talking about? Easy and Carter stare at each other, not sure how to proceed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't hire somebody to find your girlfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Until just now I was sure that she was hundreds of miles away from here... You say someone is looking for her? Easy nods, his brow furrowed in thought. Carter gets up and walks to the door, looking out into the canyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone is looking for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's goin' on between you two? Carter shrugs and stammers nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... I don't know... We were going to be married... We had a fight... (then recovering) Uh... that's none of your concern, Mr. Rawlins. He stops and looks to the floor, the gravity pulling him down... way down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone's... after her? A Mr. Albright? And he said he's working for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Do you know a man named Richard McGee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I can't say that I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would someone be after her, Mr. Carter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... I can't say -- I don't know... He's lying and Easy knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think you could find her again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's important, Mr. Rawlins, for her sake... I'm willing to pay you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Carter, why did she leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell you any more Mr. Rawlins -- I'll pay you to find her... Easy thinks about it, and then nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... a thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thousand dollars?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   I'll take two hundred right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins. I think you're trying to take advantage of me. But left me inform you that the incumbent mayor and the chief of police eat at my house regularly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.   Then they can help us--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --No.   They can't! Carter is too emphatic and Easy waits for him to give more, but instead he turns and gazes out again at the canyon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have Baxter write you out a check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70    CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Carter, why'd you stop runnin' for mayor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have Baxter write you a check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is Matthew Teran looking for her too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baxter will write you a check!! Easy takes him in and then holds out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take cash, Mr. Carter. Carter fumbles in his wallet, and too nervous to count the money, shoves the wallet at Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it all... Just take it all. Easy nods and strides out of the room. 71    OMIT                                                           71 A72   EXT. T. CARTER FOUNDATION - DAY                               A72 Easy walks to his car, gets in and drives away toward the entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Albright was working for Matthew Teran. And whatever Teran had on Carter was strong stuff... too strong even for Carter to go to the police... But because Teran was desperate to find the girl too, that gave me the best hand. I had seen her once, and if I played it right, I'd see her again. 72-75 OMIT                                                         72-75 70. MONTAGE SEQUENCE: 76   POOL HALL - THAT NIGHT                                           76 Easy talks to the short, squat, suspicious woman who runs the place. Through the smoke, other distrustful eyes fix on him from pool tables and dark corners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everywhere I went was a familiar place, but different because I was asking about buying hijacked liquor from the man nobody wanted to talk about. Frank Green...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was actually looking more and more like I might not make it through this little adventure I was having. But I was likin' the chill in my blood, and the freedom of working on my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were times in the war when I had felt like this. When life or death where the only two choices. That made it simple. And that was alright by me. 79   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - DAY                                          79 Easy unlatches the gate and pushes it open. He's tired, and he trudges up the walkway to the porch. He sees THE WOODCUTTER standing on the front lawn of the next door neighbor's, waving at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 79   CONTINUED:                                                      79 BACK TO EASY He throws a rock and then unlocks the door. But he notices THE POT OF AFRICAN VIOLETS lying broken on the cement. He looks up just in time to see a TWO-BY-FOUR swing down. BONK! And Easy is seeing stars. A big man, dressed in black, kicks open the door and drives Easy head first into 80   INT. EASY'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM                                 80 Easy slams to the floor but manages to roll out of the way of a lethal CRACK! of the board onto the floor. He grabs a lamp and hurls it at the oncoming figure who catches it on the arm and keeps on coming, snapping a blade from his fist which leaps out like a chrome-colored flame. Easy scrambles back, his head butting up against the couch, his forehead streaming blood, his eyes wide with the sight of sure death advancing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank! Wait a minute!   I need to talk to you! Frank looms over him, his   sinister but handsome brown face framed by a short-rimmed,   black Stetson hat and a black shirt and coat. He holds    the knife to Easy's neck, letting the blade press into the skin   as he talks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the reason why she told me to lay low, hunh. Easy buries himself back against the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. I got five hundred dollars for you. Rich man wants to talk to a white girl you know. Daphne... Frank's eyes flame and he presses the knife, drawing blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a dead man-- WHAP!   WHAP!   WHAP!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:                                                     80 O.S. VOICE Easy, you in there? Frank's head whips toward the door and Easy knocks the knife away and comes up tussling. Frank scrambles to get away and Easy tackles him, straining to keep Frank from reaching the knife. THE FRONT DOOR springs open and SPATS ON PATENT LEATHER SHOES clump in, the last one stomping down on Frank's outstretched fingers. Frank screams and cradles his hand in agony. Easy scrambles up to his knees and gawks up at MOUSE, dressed in a plaid zoot suit with Broadway suspenders down the front of his shirt, a long-barreled .41 caliber pistol held loosely in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Want me to kill him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouse! Aw, man naw, it's all right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what's happenin'? He holds out his hand and helps Easy to his feet. Frank makes a slight move towards the knife and Mouse levels the pistol at his head, his gold-rimmed teeth glittering from a smile that wants Frank to go for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll blow your goddamned nose off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, don't! (to Frank) Where's Daphne Monet? Frank just stares up at Easy, his eyes sharp and defiant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, if you don't know where she is, maybe we can help each other find her. After a moment, Mouse cocks the hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigga, you heard him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mouse.    Don't kill him. The phone RINGS next to Mouse and he picks it up, eyes still on Frank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?... He's busy right now, you gonna have to call back. He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank, a rich man she knows is willing to pay a thousand dollars just to talk to her. A thousand bucks, man. Frank still won't talk and that does it for Mouse.   He releases the hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, lemme try. THUNK!   He slaps Frank upside the head with the pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better... (THUNK!) Talk... (THUNK!) You stupid-- Easy grabs Mouse's arm and Frank slumps to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of my way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him be! The two friends struggle, and Frank rears up and plows into Easy, sending him sprawling to the floor on top of Mouse. Then Frank, covered in blood, hurls himself across the room, out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 81   Mouse gets to his feet and runs to the door aiming the       81 pistol, but it's too late. Easy stands up and Mouse points the gun at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you, Easy. Don't you never grab me when I got a gun in my hand! Easy silently eyes the pistol and gives Mouse a chance to calm down. After a moment Mouse looks down at his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at the blood you done got on my coat. Why you wanna go and do that? He looks out the door and grabs a small suitcase. Then spots the bathroom and moves to it, taking off his jacket and hanging the pistol in his belt. Easy holds his fingers to the bump on his forehead and catches his breath as Mouse runs water in the bathtub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now we got to find that girl so we can get that money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we don't, Mouse. I don't need your kinda help or I would've called you. Mouse comes out of the bathroom, scrubbing at a spot on his jacket with a washcloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You standing there with a knot on your head the size of a twelve- year-old tittie and you "don't need my kind of help"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the same shit you pulled five years ago when you asked me to drive you out to your stepfather's house, then come to find out you killed him and your stepbrother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, easy, that was a long time ago. Easy glares at Mouse and dabs blood from his forehead with a handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 81   CONTINUED:                                                     81 MOUSE (after a moment) Come on, Easy. Cut me in on this. I could help you. I let you run the show. I swear I will. He ambles over to Easy apologetically and holds Easy's shoulders with both hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear, I ain't gonna do nothin' you don't tell me to do. Easy knows he can't believe this but
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything I say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything you say. With no choice, Easy nods and walks into 82   THE BATHROOM                                                   82 He runs cold water onto a washcloth and looks in the mirror, dabbing at his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that called?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Sound like some white girl. Easy turns toward the door "Aw Man!" 83   INT. EASY'S CAR - DAY                                          83 Mouse, in a plum colored double-breasted suit and a brown felt derby hat, turns on the radio and the Ink Spots' "We'll Meet Again" purrs out. He starts to turn the key, but then remembers and honks the horn. 84   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - DAY                                        84 Easy opens the door and stands on the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Easy, was it a left on Richland or a right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 84   CONTINUED:                                                     84 EASY A right. And if Dupree ain't over there in Compton, just come on back 'cause I might have heard from the girl. Just then a car cruises around the corner and Easy watches MASON AND MILLER pull up across the street and get out. He glances over at Mouse. 85   INT. EASY'S CAR - DAY                                          85 Mouse shuts off the radio and slumps down in the seat out of view. 86   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - DAY                                        86 Easy watches them stroll up the walkway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins... We came to ask you a few more questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why don't you just invite us inside... (holding open the door) After you. And Easy and Miller go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your head? I don't remember doing all that. He laughs and closes the door behind them. 87   INT. EASY'S HOUSE                                              87 Miller looks around suspiciously. The room still shows signs of the struggle with Frank Green. He exchanges a look with Mason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been having a party, Ezekiel? Mason pushes Easy into the chair and Miller plants his foot on the seat between Easy's legs and leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a lotta cuts and bruises to be an ordinary working stiff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 87   CONTINUED:                                                    87 MILLER It's looking worse and worse for you, my friend. What do you know about Richard McGee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? On the other side of the room Mason picks up a chunk of the broken lamp from the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dead white man in a cabin in Laurel Canyon. Mason comes over and stands over Easy next to his partner. He fingers the sharp porcelain shard of the lamp, threatening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs out with some of those same nigger friends of yours down on Central Avenue. Easy eyes the sharp edge, making up his mind to kill this fat son-of-a-bitch if he gets too creative, and die with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just happened to have a note in his pocket with 'C. James' written on it. He holds the slip of paper up for Easy to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any of this making you feel talkative at all, 'cause I'll bet ya six bits to a bottle of piss that we're looking at a double here... All we need is to place you in the dead man's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't been in no dead man's house. Miller stands back and pats his pockets for a smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 87   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How 'bout a smoke, Ezekiel? Easy taps out one and Miller places it in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a light? Easy pulls out his lighter and sparks the flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I? Easy shrugs and passes the lighter to Miller who fires himself up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice lighter... He holds the lighter out of Mason who wraps it up in a handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we got our print.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hadn't you heard? We found a cigarette lighter in the dead man's house with the killer's fingerprints on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, man. I didn't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course you did, we got evidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't do it. You know I didn't... And Miller leans in hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know that you know more than you're lettin' on. And now a white man's been killed. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 87   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you better tell us what you know, or you're goin' down for the murder of Richard McGee and Coretta James. He straightens up and Easy stands up, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know nothin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the cuffs on. Let's take him down. As Mason reaches for the cuffs, Easy sees Mouse peek out from the kitchen doorway then disappear inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, listen!    I don't know who did it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we do... He sees Mouse draw his gun, his eyes trained on Miller's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's all that counts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit, I didn't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell it to the D.A. Mouse is trained with the hammer cocked and Easy is about to give the signal, but then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, gimme some time to find out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme till tomorrow... Tomorrow mornin'... Miller thinks about it and then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 87    CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   Tomorrow morning, that's it. He nods to Mason and Easy looks up to see Mouse raise the gun and slide back into the kitchen. Mason unlocks the cuffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a nice evening, Ezekiel. And he and Miller walk out. Easy looks out the doorway watching A88   EASY'S POV                                                       A88 MILLER AND MASON get in their squad car and drive away. BACK TO SCENE B88   He turns back to see Mouse standing in the living room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mason has taken off his shoe and is swatting it against the palm of his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy holds his hands up, helplessly -- "what do you want from me?" -- but no one can see and she has hung up the phone. 45   EXT. SUNRIDGE MOTEL - NIGHT                                      45 It's a Spanish-style set of rooms with tile roofs set around a square parking lot. Easy's car pulls into the alley behind it. He gets out and scans the area looking down from a rise at the back entrance to the parking lot. And then walks down. 46   OMIT                                                             46 47   EXT. SUNRIDGE MOTEL - ROOM 102 - NIGHT                           47 Before Easy can knock, he hears:
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: in other rooms. 50   BACK TO SCENE                                                  50 He looks back frantically and grabs her by the shoulders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He points to a crystal decanter near Easy. Easy pours himself a drink and takes in Carter as he wrings his hands to keep from going to pieces. This guy's got it bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 77   NIGHTCLUB - NEXT NIGHT                                           77 Upscale, with a balcony. Billy Eckstine fronts the band. Blacks and whites are dressed to impress, including Easy, who leans into the bartender.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 78   ABE AND JOHNNY'S LIQUOR - NEXT DAY                               78 The two JEWISH OWNERS unveil for Easy a case of hijacked liquor in a wooden crate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (wearily) I guess you know what would have happened if you had shot them two cops in my house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell yeah. They'd be dead. Easy shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, let's go. He grabs a jacket. 88-91 OMIT                                                         88-91 A92   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - DAY                                          A92 Easy hurries out of his house pulling on his jacket with Mouse right behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What they tryin' to pin on you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A92   CONTINUED:                                                       A92 EASY I'll tell you on the way.   You got the keys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And he hurries around to the driver's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we run out to Compton we got one other place to stop by... He freezes seeing the Woodcutter watching and listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, don't you mess with my trees while I'm gone. He gets in as Mouse cranks the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me.   Leave my trees alone. As Mouse starts away the old man smiles mischievously and starts to sharpen his axe. Easy leans out the car window, yelling back as the car pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean it now. Don't you mess with my trees!! 92    EXT. PORTLAND COURT - DAY                                        92 It's a horseshoe of tiny apartments with over a dozen little porches and doorways staggered in a semi-circle around a small yard that has a half-dozen stunted magnolia trees growing in brick pots. Easy and Mouse step into the courtyard, passing elderly tenants sitting inside screened doors. Jimmy Lunceford's "I'm Walking Through Heaven With You" floats out into the yard. They arrive at the closed door of number eight. Easy knocks and then knocks again, hard. Something CRASHES on the inside and heavy FOOTSTEPS pound to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 92   CONTINUED:                                                       92 EASY Easy! The door opens and JUNIOR FORNAY stands there behind the screen door in blue boxer shorts and a white T-shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's private, Junior.   Lemme in. And he reaches to pull open the door, but Junior throws the latch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't got time now.   I'm tryin' to get some sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you open the door, Junior, 'fore I have to shoot it down. Mouse steps out into the doorway, in plain view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open up.   We ain't got all night. Junior forces a smile and lets them in. 93   INT. JUNIOR'S APARTMENT - DAY                                    93 Filthy and junky, with old car parts scattered amongst old furniture, the room is unpleasant with only the benefit of a dim light -- just like Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all want a beer? He nods at a card table with one folding chair and throws two others into place on his way to the refrigerator. Easy and Mouse sit down and Junior brings over a quart of PABST BLUE RIBBON BEER and two glasses that he wipes out with a rag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ya smokin'? Zapatas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 93   CONTINUED:                                                     93 Junior tosses his pack onto the table and pours beer into the glasses for Easy and Mouse, and drinks from the bottle. Easy unfolds the handkerchief in his pocket on the table, uncovering the cigarette butt from Richard McGee's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is one of yours, ain't it? Junior looks at the butt and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You the only one I know cheap enough to smoke this shit... Why'd you kill Richard McGee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?   What you talkin' 'bout?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't no time to play, Junior.    I know you the one killed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You crazy, man. You crazy! And he stands up to emphasize his indignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, Junior. Junior shifts awkwardly from side to side and then sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me what happened, Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you talkin' 'bout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the police will. When they find out that they got your fingerprints up there in that man's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What fingerprints? What house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 93   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hattie had you pull that man out of John's the night I was there. And he was laying up there dead with the same suit on and a knife in his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't killed nobody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quit lyin', you big ole sweaty- thick headed-cornbread eatin'-- Mouse can't keep from laughing and Junior starts up after Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You thick-headed, ya damn self!! But Mouse is up, still laughing with the pistol in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, man... 'fore I blow your brains out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kinda shit y'all trying to pull here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down. Junior sits down and throws himself around in the chair like a child throwing a fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better tell it the way it happened. And maybe I'll forget what I know... Otherwise, I'm gonna tell Mouse to shoot ya 'cause you know I don't like your ass and he don't like you either. Mouse slaps the table, laughing so hard he's in tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, man... And he aims the pistol and cocks the hammer, causing Junior to throw himself around some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 93   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed him to take his money, didn't ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't even know who you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just had to rob him, didn't ya!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't! I didn't touch nothin' in his house! SILENCE. But it's in the open now and Junior frowns and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hattie had me take him out to his car. And he say he give me ten dollars to drive him home. Mouse is busy working a toothpick between his front teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you took that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, yeah. Then he asked me about that white girl you was askin' everybody about at the club. And I told him I seen her with Coretta... What the hell I care if he know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell him but you won't tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like your ass, Easy.   And he gimme fifty dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty dollars? Just to tell him you seen her with Coretta?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.   To deliver a letter. Easy is stopped for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What letter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 93    CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How should I know? He just said to give it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you knew where she was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say that! I give it to Coretta to give it to her the next mornin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You 'spect me to believe that? Why would he trust you to give it to the girl if it was worth fifty dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause he had to blow town, fool! Easy stops to make the connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better be tellin' the truth. Let's go, Raymond. He and Mouse get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tellin' the truth. I ain't killed nobody. That man was alive when I left him! Easy opens the door, looking back at Junior, who's still going on and walks out. 94-95 OMIT                                                         94-95 96    INT. EASY'S CAR - DUSK                                           96 Compton looks a lot like Texas, with unpaved streets and little country-styled houses set back away from the road behind vegetable gardens and chicken coops and small sheds with a horse or a cow tied up.
direction.name: direction
