direction.raw_text: . 96   CONTINUED:                                                       96 Easy and Mouse pull into    the gravel driveway of a little house and are met by the    usual barking dog you find in the country -- part Spaniel,    part Shepherd, and some kind of Retriever. It dogs Easy     and Mouse's heels as they get out of the car. 97   EXT. DUPREE'S SISTER'S HOUSE - DUSK                              97 They notice the light in the front window go out and the shade pull back slightly as they walk toward the front door. Moments later the door opens and the dark figure of Dupree Brouchard appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. Go on in the back. The dog obeys and Easy and Mouse walk up the walkway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Dupree.    Been trying to call you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Easy! Cops just let me out today. My sister gone to work and I didn't feel much like talking... Raymond...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, big man!    Them pigtails I smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Lula Mae made some 'fore she went to work. Dupree ushers them in. 98   INT. DUPREE'S SISTER'S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DUSK                    98 Dupree's face under the kitchen light shows two swollen black eyes from a brutal police "questioning." His eyes are heavy with liquor and tears glisten down his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why somebody wanna kill her like that? Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Dupree... I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 98   CONTINUED:                                                       98 Dupree pours rye whiskey into a water glass in front of Mouse, who swallows half the shot without looking up from his plate of food. Easy declines when the bottle comes his way, feeling the pressure of time running out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Coretta ever say anything to you about a letter she was keeping?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letter?   What kinda letter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For that white girl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. But I know it was on account of her that Coretta got killed. Easy rears back in his chair with keen interest and Mouse looks up from his pigtails. Dupree takes a drink and his eyes narrow in anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything between Coretta and that Daphne was always such a damn secret... I mean that ole girl didn't think nothin' about two- timin' on Frank... She probably 'innerduced' Coretta to one of them ole guys she knew... And when he came to the house after Coretta... (starting to break) ...he found out she wasn't that kinda woman... Cops said she fought him... aw my Gawd... fought him 'cause she wouldn't have nobody but me-e-e... He buries his face into his hands and Easy throws a sad but frustrated look to Mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw Gawd, I can't even go to sleep... 'cause I can still see her face that mornin' 'fore I went to work... (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 98    CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior had been by and just left the house... and she came runnin' out to the car carrying her bible... And she said, 'Keep this for me, baby.' Easy and Mouse exchange looks.   JACKPOT!   And Dupree falls apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police won't even let me go near her house. So it's the only thing I got left from her. It was a sign... I know it was a sign, 'cause she was so religious...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right, big man... it's all right... And he pours Dupree a half glass of rye. 99    THE BOTTLE - LATER, NIGHT                                        99 Barely a "corner" of whiskey lies at the bottom and DUPREE is snoring like a buzzsaw, sound asleep. MOUSE squints into his glass, wondering why it's empty, and looks down the length of the kitchen leading into 100   THE BEDROOM - NIGHT                                             100 Drawers are pulled out on the dresser, and Easy is rifling through another until he pulls out a bible. He fans the pages, finding THE LETTER already opened.    His fingers pull out a photograph and then two more. BACK TO EASY His excited face goes sick, and he silently mouths:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shi-it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 100   CONTINUED:                                                       100 EASY (V.O.) I was as nauseated from fear as I was from what I saw... Pictures of a much younger Matthew Teran and children... innocent, helpless, naked children... 101   KITCHEN                                                          101 Easy hurries in holding up the letter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it. Come on, I think that girl is gonna call again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Dupree is a good man, but he sure can't hold his liquor. Easy grabs his coat off a chair and starts to put it on, stuffing the letter in his coat pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got your sails up pretty far too, Raymond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You callin' me drunk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you been puttin' it away along with him and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I was drunk could I do this? And in less than a heartbeat he has pulled that long- barreled pistol and is aiming it at Easy's forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't a man in Texas can outdraw me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. And he puts the gun back in his shoulder holster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 101   CONTINUED:                                                    101 MOUSE Go for your gun. Let's see who gets kilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a gun, Raymond.   Come on, let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fool enough to go without a piece then you must wanna be dead. He lays the pistol on the table then draws a .32 automatic from his waist, this time cocking the hammer, the muzzle only inches from Easy's head. Easy can tell from the glazed look in Mouse's eye that instead of seeing him, his friend is glaring at some demon he carries around in his head. So he stands stock still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him go, Raymond... He done learned his lesson. If you kill him then he won't have got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He fool enough to call me out and he ain't even got no gun? I'll kill the motherfucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him live, Raymond, and he be scared whenever you walk in the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Motherfucker better be scared. I kill a motherfucker. I kill him! Easy stares down the barrel of the gun for a long moment until Mouse blinks, then nods and lets the pistol fall down into his lap. His head on his chest, he's sound asleep. Easy takes the gun and puts it on the table with the other. Then walks to the doorway and turns out the light. 102   INT. EASY'S CAR - NIGHT                                       102 The dim street lamps of Easy's neighborhood streak past as Easy scans the streets and sidewalks, wary for anybody who might be staking him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 102   CONTINUED:                                                     102 EASY (V.O.) The pictures were burnin' a hole in my pocket... I had no doubt that Albright had killed McGee... and that he had done it for Matthew Teran... But Teran hadn't known who killed Coretta. I was sure of that, too. 103   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                      103 Easy's car pulls up and he gets out and looks around cautiously before starting up the walkway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the first time I hated walking up to my house... I still didn't know if I could go to the police. But Albright was liable to be showing up in a few hours asking about Frank Green. I was thinking I oughta forget the girl and leave town, back to Houston or Galveston where they didn't know me too good. Easy gets to the door, still literally looking over his shoulder, and hears the phone RINGING inside. He unlocks the door and bursts in. 104   INT. EASY'S HOUSE                                              104 He races through the dark living room and into 105   INT. BEDROOM                                                   105 And picks up the phone but the dial tone DRONES on the other end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!   Damn! He whacks the nightstand with the receiver, dying with frustration. And SOMETHING MOVES in the dark. He lunges and grabs DAPHNE MONET and pulls her into the light, then sits down onto the bed before the shock can knock him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:                                                      105 Easy shakes his head in disbelieving relief and she reaches to touch the bump on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your boyfriend, Frank Green, threw a surprise party for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Easy... He pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, Coretta's boyfriend, Dupree, got out of jail today. And...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing)                    (he joins her) I need you to help me           You need me to help you find him.                       find him. Easy shakes his head, amused, and lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: already have the pictures... Daphne stiffens, as if from an electrical shock, and then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, I paid seven thousand dollars for those pictures. They belong to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? Matthew Teran may have somethin' to say about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, you wouldn't dare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try me.   Who killed Coretta?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know -- I'll pay you for them. I'll give you a thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave Richard seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll give you seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get seven thousand dollars from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind. I'll give it to you. Easy, please. They're very important to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coretta's life was important to a few people too. What's say you tell me who killed her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, honey, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Honey?' Do Frank and Carter really fall for that stuff? Come on... You and Todd Carter have a fight and all of a sudden he doesn't wanna be mayor no more... You leave, he's worried but he can't even get his buddies in the police department to help him find you... And now you wanna buy some pictures of Teran. Why? 'Cause he's got some dirt on you. She gets up and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, why don't you just take the money!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what Frank told Coretta? She whirls around to face him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was she being too nosy? Or was she just being Coretta and trying to bargain up the price?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, please.  How much do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me. Is Frank your husband or your pimp? SMACK! She swings and open hand across his face, and SMACK! He returns the gesture, sending her back onto the bed... He picks up the phone and dials "O."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, put the phone down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you try screaming again? 'Cause I bet police like white women with Negro boyfriends who hijack trucks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, please. She reaches for the phone and he pushes her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet they like pimps, and whores, too, who scam rich white men like Carter runnin' for mayor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, please, put it down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm sure they like it when these white girls tell their colored men to lay low 'cause they killed a woman over some pictures of another rich white man. She gathers herself, just as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frank is my brother. Easy is about to speak, but then stands still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number please? He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks away, worn out, tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have different fathers. Mine is white... Frank doesn't even know that Todd and I broke up. So far I've kept him out of all this. She gets up and takes Easy's cigarettes and taps one out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, Coretta's the only one out here in L.A. besides my brother who knew about me... (she lights up) And about a month ago she took a job working for, of all people, Matthew Teran. She made friends with one of the girls in the office who told her that she'd heard that Teran was a pedophile. And Coretta got carried away and told her that Todd Carter was engaged to a colored woman. She was sorry and didn't think it would get to Teran... but it did and he got a hold of my birth records.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who killed her, Daphne? Daphne exhales smoke and brushes hair out of her face ignoring the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Todd and I broke up and I paid a guy for the pictures of Teran. But somehow Coretta got them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who killed her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an accident. Coretta and I were still mad at each other. I mean, she threatened to sell Teran the pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who killed her goddammit!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 105   CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just asked Joppy to go over and put a scare in her... It was an accident. FLASHBACK: 106   INT. KITCHEN - CORETTA'S HOUSE                                 106 Joppy points a finger in Coretta's face, backing her against the counter. She grabs a knife from a rack of dishes left out to dry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joppy said she pulled a knife and tried to dump hot water on him... She swipes at Joppy and he backhands her against the stove... She struggles to grab a pot of boiling water, but he wrests it from her and slings her across the room against the counter, her head striking the tile on the way down. 107   BACK TO SCENE                                                  107 Daphne looks down at her hands. She stubs out her cigarette and sits on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I didn't mean to hurt anybody... It's just that with the pictures I can--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Marry Carter?   Be white again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't judge me, Easy! Do you think I like pretending that I'm someone else? Do you know how I've been treated by people, colored and white, when I've tried to live as a colored woman in a colored community. Do you have any idea what any colored man whose ever been with me has had to go through? Don't you dare judge me! She sees Easy hesitate and she stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Easy. Help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 107   CONTINUED:                                                     107 She moves in close, caressing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, you know it's the right thing to do... You know if things were different what would happen between us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what can happen between us. You get Carter to clear me up from all this and you can have your pictures. That's all that could have ever happened between us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, baby. Of course, sweetheart... The sound of the front door pushing open startles them, and Albright knocks on his way in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'll be damned. You found her. And Manny and Shariff step in, too, carrying baseball bats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute, Albright. Daphne breaks for the back way and Easy tries to bar Shariff from going after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Manny swings the baseball bat into Easy's side. and Easy yells and plows into him, wrestling him against the wall. Albright grabs Easy from behind and pries him free enough for Manny to uppercut him to the chin with the fat end of the bat. Easy sinks to his knees seeing double. Shariff leads Daphne back into the room, her face contorted into tears, her arm twisted up behind her in a hammerlock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 107   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are the pictures?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. SMACK!   He backhands her. Easy grabs for the wall to get to his feet and Manny swings the bat down into his kidney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't tell him! And I won't tell you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you will. (to Shariff) Let's go. Shariff leads Daphne outside and Manny draws his forty-five automatic and trains it on Easy, cocking the hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doin'? Who are we gonna give 'em to cover this shit, hunh?... Use your head. He shoves Manny through the door and pushes Easy onto his side with his foot and he's out the door. Easy strains to get back to his knees as car doors slam and the sound of a car engine growls to life. He thrusts himself up from the floor and stumbles toward the front door like a boxer who should have stayed down for the count. He gets it open in time to see... 108   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                      108 The blurred white form of Albright's Caddy screaming away, shattering the dark, shrieking in flight. Dogs are barking and a baby is screaming somewhere in the neighborhood while lights are going on up and down the block. Easy stumbles back inside and into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 109   THE BEDROOM                                                       109 Where he manages to dial the phone.      It RINGS several times on the other end, and finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts down the receiver, missing the cradle, and staggers out of the room. 110   INT. EASY'S CAR - NIGHT                                           110 Easy is ripping through the night, the streetlights flashing by in blurs of light. The windows down, he's coming to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The street is still alive. A couple of late night juke joints are coughing up the last drunken bits of the party onto the sidewalk to straggle home. Easy's car screams around the corner, and then skids in, sending a heavy-hipped young sister, about to cross the street, scrambling for cover. He jumps out just as Mouse scorches the tires on Dupree's '38 Packard in behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111   CONTINUED:                                                     111 EASY (to the woman) Sorry, baby... Lemme give you twenty bucks for them stockings you got on. It takes a moment to register, but when she sees him pull a twenty from his pocket, she gets busy. He runs back to Mouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme one of them guns you got. Mouse smiles, loving this side of Easy, and trades him a set of car keys for a .32 automatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start up my car. I'm comin' out fast. He runs back to the woman he almost hit and hands off the twenty, grabbing one of the nylons, leaving her still stripping as he runs into 112   INT. STAIRWAY                                                  112 He takes the steps two at a time, pulling the stocking down over his face as he reaches the top and bursts through the open door leading into 113   INT. JOPPY'S BAR                                               113 He charges through the raucous laughter of the half-full room right up to the bar. Joppy nearly drops the glasses he is clearing away as he looks down the barrel of the pistol aimed at his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Joppy. Let's go! Joppy hesitates, recognizing the voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me.  I'll blow your head off! And he cocks the hammer, causing Joppy to get a move on from behind the bar. Easy shoves him through the door, calling back to the startled crowd on his way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113    CONTINUED:                                                     113 EASY Don't follow me, goddammit! And he's gone. 114    INT. JOPPY'S BAR - NIGHT                                       114 Easy hides the piece in his coat pocket as he bum rushes Joppy to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he shoves Joppy into the back seat, getting in next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouse pulls off, around the corner, down the street into an alley. A115   INT. EASY'S CAR - IN THE ALLEY                                A115 Mouse pulls to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . B115   EXT. ALLEY - NIGHT                                             B115 The car roars down the alley and turns right onto the street. 115    INT. CAR - INDUSTRIAL STREET - NIGHT                           115 EASY (to Joppy) You sure 'bout this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he pulls out his pistol, aiming it back over the seat at Joppy as he drives. KABLAAM! The bullet slams through the rear window just to the side of Joppy's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KABLAAM! This one digs out a chunk of upholstery between Joppy and Easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car screeches to a halt and Mouse tries to aim again. But Easy struggles with Mouse's gun hand still holding a pistol on Joppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KABLAAM!   This one rips through the roof. Joppy's yelling, afraid that Easy's gun will go off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 115   CONTINUED:                                                    115 EASY Mouse, the girl offered me seven thousand dollars for the pictures. Mouse glares into the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lyin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I swear I'm not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw shit! And he fumbles with the ignition and shifts gears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God!... Oh, my goodness! 116   EXT. L.A. STREET - NIGHT                                      116 The engine roars from a punch to the accelerator, and Mouse's voice can be heard cutting through the darkness as the car powers off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my goodness! 117   INT. EASY'S CAR - NIGHT                                       117 Easy, with the gun on Joppy, strains to see the dimly lit road in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that it up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's it. 118   THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD                                        118 The headlights bounce off a signpost: "Route 9." 119   EXT. ROUTE 9 - NIGHT                                          119 The Pontiac makes the turn onto a graded dirt road. 120   INT. EASY'S CAR - NIGHT                                       120 A ranch-style cabin emerges up off the road, drawing nearer in the headlight beams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 121   BACK TO SCENE                                                     121 EASY Shut off the headlights, Mouse. Mouse kills the lights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.   It's farther up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much farther?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another ten minutes, I guess. Easy, I swear, I ain't done nothin' to nobody. I swear, I ain't. 122   EXT. ROUTE 9 - NIGHT                                              122 THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD:    House lights show through thick shrubbery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it is. Mouse pulls to a stop and kills the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's some rope in the trunk, Raymond. Mouse gets out of the car and is heard opening the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, come on, man. That girl is lying if she told you I killed them folks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said she told me? SCREAM! It's muted and distant.     But it's a woman all right. SCREAM! Easy pushes out of the back door on the right as Mouse opens the opposite door on the driver's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuff this in his mouth.    I gotta get up there. He tosses Mouse the stocking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 122   CONTINUED:                                                      122 MOUSE Let's just shoot him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Mouse. And they'll hear it. 123   EXT. ALBRIGHT'S CABIN - NIGHT                                   123 The cabin draws nearer as Easy scrambles up the hill. He can hear Daphne crying out something, but he can't make out the words. It quiets down as he nears and sees shadows crossing a window with the shade pulled down. He moves cautiously, quietly to the window and peers through the crack between the shade and the windowsill. He can make out a sliver of what looks like a large room with a low ceiling. SMACK! And Daphne screams again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, talk to me. Talk to me while you still can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! I don't have them!     Easy has them! Easy can barely make out Shariff passing the window.   He strains to see more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said he didn't know anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was lying!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Grab that for me, Shariff. It's ready. And then SCRE-E-EAM!! The kind that drops the bottom out of your stomach. The kind more akin to fear than the word itself... The kind that fries your skin with the cold chill of horror. S-C-R-E-EAMS again!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No-o-o-o!   Please. No-o-o!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now talk to me, goddammit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 123   CONTINUED:                                                         123 DAPHNE'S VOICE No-o-o! 124   Easy's gotta make a move. KABLANGALANGLE! He smashes the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (slurring) Get Dupree's car. Drive it to 78th and Central... The butcher shop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It had come to me in less time than it takes to think that Albright was taking Daphne someplace more isolated than that office building downtown... Someplace where there would be no witnesses... And I was being left alive to take the fall. 111   EXT. BUTCHER SHOP/JOPPY'S BAR - NIGHT                             111
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Joppy) Albright's got the girl. He's gonna kill her. Where would he take her? And you better get it right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screaming, pressing the gun) Don't fool with me, man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a cabin out in Malibu on Route 9...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess so. He's done this kinda thing out there before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy, what's done got into you? Thought y'all was friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mouse, we need him to lead the way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: window with the gun and the shade rattles all the way up. Manny looks right up at his face as Daphne arches and flails, trying to get free from his hands that are pinning her down on a battered old sofa. Albright is holding a glowing red poker that Shariff, standing in front of the fireplace, has just handed him. Easy starts blasting.   KABLAAM!   Manny takes one to the throat. KABLAAM! Albright and Shariff lunge for cover, and Daphne ducks down behind the back of the sofa, screaming and screaming. Manny, hand to his throat, pulls his gun on reflex, firing into the floor and then half runs, half staggers out the side door just ahead of another KABLAAM! that digs out a chunk of the wall. Easy hears the screen door open and then ducks down, getting ready for Manny who should be coming his way from the side door. He HEARS more steps stumble out and then... SILENCE. And then, KABLAAM! BLAAM! Two huge blasts rip right through the wall next to Easy's head, and he scrambles to the side of the house, underneath another window with the shade pulled down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell's out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That you, Easy? (SILENCE) Tell us what you want, buddy.   See what we can work out. Easy HEARS footsteps coming alongside the house where he had been moments ago. KABLAAM! BLAAM! Albright has fired from the inside again, thinking it's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouse?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 124   CONTINUED:                                                       124 But it's Manny, clutching his throat, gurgling for air, stumbling aimlessly off down the hill. A walking dead man... EASY hears him tumble into some shrubbery and after a moment the gurgling stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy... Hey, Buddy (then to Shariff) Come on, goddammit! Daphne cries out and KLABLANGLE! Easy breaks the window with the gun but KABLAAM! BLAAM! BLAAM! The windowsill tears out above his head and Daphne screams again. Easy looks up to see Shariff, holding her in front of him as a shield. He's headed straight for Easy, drawing a bead on him for the kill. And then KABLAAM! the back of Shariff's skull flies off and MOUSE is in the side door, blasting.     BLAAM! Albright breaks for the window. BLAAM! The slug spins him halfway around but he hurls himself through the window backwards. Easy scurries to the front of the house and BLAAM! The bullet goes wide and Albright manages to get into his car and returns fire. BLAAM! BLAAM!... Easy hits the deck. Albright's engine roars to life and he SQUEALS out on the gravel. Mouse appears on the other side of the house and CLICK! CLICK! he's out of ammo. He pulls out the other pistol, but it's too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, damn, damn! I hit him!     I hit him! Easy gets up from the ground and trudges into the front door. 125   INT. ALBRIGHT'S CABIN                                            125 Easy finds Daphne standing in the middle of the room, her whole body quaking in shock. He takes off his jacket and drapes it around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... You all right? Her top lip is swollen and bloody and she has a dark bruise on her cheek... She jerks her head, nodding "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 125   CONTINUED:                                                     125 As he leads her through the doorway, he stops to look back at Shariff's legs sprawling out on the floor from behind the sofa. 126   EXT. ALBRIGHT'S CABIN - NIGHT                                  126 He leads her down the front porch and hears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's blood all over here... I got him. Mouse gets up from squatting down, grinning, the gold rims of his teeth catching a glint from the light coming through the door. He looks Daphne over, admiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn.   Sweetheart. Easy leads her past, quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   Let's go. 127   EXT. ROUTE 9 - NIGHT                                           127 Mouse opens the back seat door of the car and Easy sees that there's no one there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Joppy? And then he looks around quickly, seeing JOPPY'S BODY lying off on the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? Mouse shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have time to be tying him up. Daphne sees the body too and starts gagging. Easy's face twists into helpless pain and he holds a handkerchief to Daphne's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, man?   Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 127    CONTINUED:                                                        127 MOUSE Why what? You just said don't shoot him. And I didn't... I choked his ass... Easy helps Daphne into the car and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he goes around to the passenger side of the car to get in. Unlike up at the house this was murder -- the same as it had been in Texas with Mouse's stepfather and brother. Tears of rage well up in Easy's eyes as he hears the car door close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daphne sits in the car, her eyes staring straight ahead, still in shock. 128    EXT. PLATFORM - NIGHT                                             128 A few people hurry to board the train, Easy and Mouse among them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 128   CONTINUED:                                                       128 EASY (V.O.) (CONT'D) Because she was still in shock and couldn't really talk... Maybe too because she had stolen about four times that much from Carter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, if you think you gonna have trouble with that dude Frank, I can run by and kill him and take that evening train to Houston.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, man. He has had enough of Mouse for a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   This is for you. And he pulls out something wrapped up in a brown paper bag from his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cut you in for half 'cause I knew you was too big a fool to take your share from that white girl yourself. Easy stares numbly at the package and then takes it. The conductor gets on board and the train starts making those metal on metal sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send my grip to Etta Mae. I'm gonna see if she'll take me back now that I'm flush. He slaps Easy on the shoulder and boards the train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, here's the keys to Dupree's car. He tosses them, and the train starts moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you need somebody to run them streets with ya, gimme a call. You know how to put some money in a nigga's pocket. And he laughs, flashing gold teeth pulling away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 128   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew I would see him again and I didn't know how I felt about that... 'cause, unlike Mouse, my legs were like rubber... the way they had been in the war the whole two years I was there. 129   EXT. GRIFFITH PARK OBSERVATORY - NIGHT                         129 Easy sits in his car smoking a cigarette, rubbing his aching chin, looking out at DAPHNE AND CARTER standing on the lawn in front of the planetarium. Carter wanders after Daphne, explaining while she paces back and forth in anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could tell how it was gonna go when Carter asked us to meet him at the Observatory instead of at his house... She knew it, too. But she had come this far and she had to play it out. Suddenly, Daphne stops abruptly and strides hurriedly back toward the car. Carter follows behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daphne!   Daphne, sweetheart! He starts over, too, but then stops, knowing here's no use. 130   INT. CAR - NIGHT                                               130 She gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Easy. Let's go. Easy throws a look over at Carter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, you can give him the pictures yourself. And she throws them down on the seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 131   OMIT                                                           131 132   Easy fires up the engine and pulls away with Daphne
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How I'm gonna help you back there foolin' 'round with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, man. If you didn't want him kilt you shouldn't have left him with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : A128   EXT. GLENDALE TRAIN STATION - NIGHT                              A128
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I convinced Mouse to take the two o'clock train to Pomona and to let me handle everything else. He could get a train back to Houston later that morning... He was fine with that but only because he was seven thousand dollars richer. Daphne had gotten the money out of a locker at the YMCA without a word... (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looking straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm sorry. The slight twist of her head amounts to a shrug and then the tears flow. The sun is coming up over the city below...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the first time I felt that I could fall in love with her, too... I was even wondering if it was starting to happen when I dropped her off at 63rd and Dinker where her brother, Frank, was waiting... Then it occurred to me that she still had Carter's money... and I felt like a fool. 133   INT. CITY HALL                                                 133 Easy walks onto the rotunda holding a hand to his aching kidney. A secretary comes out to meet him and as she leaves, Todd Carter and a group of men in business suits converge on him, shaking hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evidently Carter had told all his cronies about the pictures because they were all smiles and handshakes and "how do ya do"... The Mayor, the police chief... The newspaper; land developers. All the men who ran the City, and who really stood to gain by who was the Mayor for the next six years. The group fans out leaving Carter and Easy alone to walk off down a hallway. 134   OMIT                                                           134 135   OMIT                                                           135 136   INT. MAYOR'S OFFICE                                            136 Spacious and heavy in leather and wood with a not-so- spectacular view of the mountains. It's cold and official like the job itself. Carter pulls a brown envelope from inside his coat pocket, not unlike Albright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 136   CONTINUED:                                                    136 CARTER Here's the remaining eight hundred that I owe you... in cash... And another thousand which I hope will keep this whole thing... you know. Easy nods a tentative "sure."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I've taken care of your problems with the police. You'll have no more trouble there. And that's a promise. Easy nods and starts to go, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Rawlins... did Daphne ever say... she loved me? Easy shrugs, not knowing how to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would it really matter if she did, Mr. Carter? Carter nods sadly and Easy walks away leaving him a lonely figure amidst all his power. 137   EXT. CITY HALL - DAY                                          137 Easy holds his kidney and lowers himself gingerly down the granite steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd been thinking about Daphne, too... wondering if she meant what she said about what could have happened between us... But at the moment I was wondering if there was any such thing as a sprained chin. But other than that and a headache, a loose tooth and a kidney that a doctor would need to look at, I felt like five thousand, three hundred dollars... And unless Albright was alive somewhere, that feelin' was gonna last a while. O.S. VOICE Hey, Ezekiel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 137   CONTINUED:                                                    137 Miller and Mason are waiting outside their car at the curb. They come over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got some mighty powerful friends up there... mighty powerful. But, see, we got a problem. Easy listens disinterestedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the Chief sealing these things up like this, it doesn't do much for the morale of the men who've been working on these cases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   Makes 'em feel like shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a guy who's been callin' on the phone. And we're pretty sure that he was up there with McGee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... uh... colored guy... sounds kinda dumb...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very bright... But he said you accused him of the murder. And he swears you were up there, too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In fact, he's out and out pointing the finger at ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about a name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd do it to you... Easy waits to make sure they're finished, and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, fellas. But I gotta go. He starts away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 137   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you go back to the station and, uh... wait around for my call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son-of-a-bitch... You watch yourself, you hear! Don't you even spit on the fucking sidewalk... I better not even-- Mason's voice fades under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be the last moment of my adult life spent free was walking away from City Hall. 138   EXT. EASY'S HOUSE - DAY                                       138 A NEWSPAPER HEADLINE reads: "Carter Back In Race." The subheading reads: "Quiet Civic Leader Returns As Flamboyant Teran Quits."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The paper treated the mysterious flip-flop like it happened every day. And I could tell that Matthew Teran wouldn't spend a day in jail... Back in the second section of the paper was a small article about an unidentified man found dead, slumped over the steering wheel of a white Cadillac just north of Malibu... FURTHER BACK, we see that Odell is reading the newspaper, nursing a can of ale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It scared me to think about a world that could kill a man like DeWitt Albright... What could a world like that do to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Easy, where's your car? Easy looks up from pulling weeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 138   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the shop... I'm havin' it fixed up a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Man can't get no decent job in this town without a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shoot.   I ain't studyin' no job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't thinkin' 'bout no job?   How you gonna live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna go to work for myself. Take a little money I got saved up and go into real estate... Start fixin' up folks' gardens again... and do a few favors on the side... Favors for friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you talkin' 'bout, 'favors'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, like a woman offered me thirty dollars to go track down her husband for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You talkin' about private investigatin' or somethin'... You could get in trouble doin' that. Easy keeps working.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a man once said to me, Odell: 'Walk out your door in the morning and you're already in trouble'... It's just how you're mixed up in that trouble that counts. Easy gets up and turns on the water hose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Odell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Easy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 138   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you got a friend that does bad and you still keep him as your friend, even though you know what he's like... Do you think that's right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All you got is your friends, Easy... Easy starts to nod, but then spots THE WOODCUTTER hovering over a rosebush in a neighbor's yard across the street, his shears ready to cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of that yard! (to Odell) Bastard cut down two of my trees. Easy picks up a rock and sails it. Odell comes off the porch and does the same. Then a neighbor from across the street joins in. THE WOODCUTTER ambles off toward another block, leaving Easy, Odell and the neighbor gathered in the middle of the street. 139   UP THE BLOCK                                                   139 a man with a pony is setting up a camera. A few children have gathered, and more are running over from other parts of the neighborhood. The man props up a hand-painted sign, "Cowboy Pictures -- 15 Cents," and lifts the first customer onto the pony positioning a cowboy hat on the child's head. 140   BACK TO SCENE                                                  140 Another neighbor joins Easy and company, and they continue to laugh and talk, looking up from time to time to wave at friends in passing cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought about what Odell had said about friends and it made sense to me... (MORE)
direction.name: direction
